channel.title: Posts on Trevor F. Freeman
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Trevor F. Freeman

item.title: Python post for the project
item.description: Introduction I’ve run Python code in a Jupyter notebook many times, but I wasn’t aware that it could be run within an Rmarkdown file. Not only is it possible to knit Python code in an Rmarkdown file, but you can actually make R and Python play together. I’m going to show off just a little bit of that here but keep it pretty simple. Running python code in an Rmarkdown file Then, to run Python code it’s as simple as making a python code chunk (using {python}) and run your code.

item.title: Nonsense post
item.description: It seems like someone in my apartment constantly has a car alarm going off, and they have the hardest time getting it turned off. This just happened pretty late at night, and I was afraid my dog was going to start barking at the sudden noise. Thankfully she stayed quiet, but she was definitely annoyed. I feel you girl - if I could make it stop I definitely would.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
